title: This Thanksgiving, the Masks Are Off, the Dinner’s Inside and the Relatives Are Back
sub_head: Weary of the pandemic and reassured by vaccines, many people say they want to celebrate holidays more normally—indoors, without masks, with more of their relatives and friends
body:
Many families who canceled big gatherings last year are planning a return to larger celebrations for Thanksgiving this year.
In 2020, Lindsay Towne’s family scrapped their usual extended-family gathering. The 31-year-old had a quiet meal for five at home, and resorted to exchanging dishes with other relatives outdoors at a Famous Dave’s parking lot.
